title: Region bounded by square root, linear functions

content.question: Let R be the region in the first quadrant enclosed by the graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mrow> <mtext>6</mtext> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mtext>4</mtext> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B62@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, the line y = 2x, and the y-axis. (a) Find the area of R.

frqParts.text: Let R be the region in the first quadrant enclosed by the graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mrow> <mtext>6</mtext> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mtext>4</mtext> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B62@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, the line y = 2x, and the y-axis. (a) Find the area of R.
(b) Set up, but do not integrate, an integral expression in terms of a single variable for the volume of the solid generated when R is revolved about the x-axis.
(c) Set up, but do not integrate, an integral expression in terms of a single variable for the volume of the solid generated when R is revolved about the y-axis.

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
